Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: துன்பத்திற்கு யாரே துணையாவார் தாமுடையநெஞ்சந் துணையல் வழி.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: And who will aid me in my hour of grief, If my own heart comes not to my relief?.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown sinking in a deep, dark sea of sorrow ('துன்பத்திற்கு'). They are looking around desperately for help.
Layered_Composition.Midground: All external sources of help are shown to be absent or distant. There are no friendly hands, no rescue boats.
Layered_Composition.Background: The ultimate betrayal is shown: their own heart ('தம்முடைய நெஞ்சம்'), which should be their closest ally, is depicted as a separate figure standing on the shore, refusing to offer help ('துணையல் வழி'). The image poses the rhetorical question: If your own heart won't help you, who else possibly can? ('யாரே துணையாவார்?')

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A lament on the ultimate state of helplessness: when one is in sorrow, if one's own heart is not an ally, then no other help is possible.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The sea of sorrow is a classic metaphor. The personification of the heart as a disloyal bystander on the shore is the crucial, tragic element. It is the final and most devastating abandonment.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Utterly helpless, abandoned, betrayed by oneself, desperate.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A dark, stormy, and desperate scene. The sea of sorrow is a cold, deep black. The person sinking is lit by a dim, failing light. The heart on the shore is cast in a cold, indifferent shadow.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A wide, desperate shot from the perspective of the sinking person, looking towards the unhelpful heart on the distant shore.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, hyper-realistic, with advanced water effects and a focus on the expression of utter despair.
